"When I'm president, you will have to do what I say!"  "When I'm president, I will get *two* scoops of ice cream, and you will only get one!"  "When I'm president, if you say mean things to me I'll just say 'Get him out of here', and the police will come and drag you away!"  His words and ideas are a child's vision of power. This is by his own admission, in a way:  [quote] >Donald Trump's temper-tantrum tactics have been explained by the man himself. The frontrunner for the Republican presidential nomination admitted to his biographer that, "When I look at myself in the first grade and I look at myself now, I‚Äôm basically the same. The temperament is not that different."  >Pulitzer-Prize winning reporter Michael D'Antonio, whose book, Never Enough: Donald Trump and the Pursuit of Success, comes out in late September, nabbed the quotable gem during his six hours of interviews with the real estate king . . .
